pain_points.description: Lack of orientation for new users.
supporting_quotes: I think it would be very useful if there was a way that we could walk new people through how to use the website.
Most people who are successful right away either go to the orientation and walk through it there or they meet somebody like Debbie Rare and have a personal view orientation step by step.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Frequently mentioned, with high emotional intensity due to the frustration of new users.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Relying on orientation sessions or personal assistance from experienced users.
pain_points.impact: New users may struggle to navigate the website, leading to a poor initial experience.

supporting_quotes: I also think that the navigation can be improved because people have a hard time finding where they want to go.
I think it would be really important to include the day of the week of the events like Thursday or Friday because that's not always clear.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Frequently mentioned, with significant frustration expressed.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users may try to guess or search multiple sections without clear guidance.
pain_points.impact: Users may miss out on events or become discouraged from using the website.

pain_points.description: Lack of clarity regarding waiting list status.
supporting_quotes: If you sign up for the waiting list, it's not clear how many people are on the waiting list.
If you're number one, you probably get in. If you're number 40, you won't get in.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Mentioned occasionally, but indicates a strong user need for clarity.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users may have to inquire directly or make assumptions about their status.
pain_points.impact: Users may feel uncertain about their chances of getting into an event.

supporting_quotes: It might be good to have that be also available in the summary.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Mentioned occasionally; users express frustration when discovering costs after showing interest.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users may avoid clicking on events or search for prices on external sites.
pain_points.impact: Users may spend time on events they cannot afford, leading to disappointment.

pain_points.description: Need for segmented navigation based on user demographics.
supporting_quotes: I think it would be also good if the navigation was segmented by category, especially the 20 to 40s and the 40 and above.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Mentioned as a suggestion, indicating a desire for improvement.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users may manually filter or guess where their interests align.
pain_points.impact: Users may have a harder time finding relevant content, leading to frustration.
